title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Mt. Blue Middle School principal James Black criticized for dressing as ICE agent for Halloween.
The incident occurred off school grounds; superintendent confirms awareness and addresses concerns from staff.
Immigrant advocacy group condemns costume, stating it invokes fear and trauma among immigrant students.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez left Sunday's game with a head injury but was cleared after passing concussion protocol.
Gonzalez hit his head while defending a 40-yard catch by Atlanta's Drake London, who caught 9 passes for 118 yards.
Gonzalez said he felt able to return, but the Patriots' offense finished the game, securing a one-point victory.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents collected 180 discarded needles from Southwest Corridor Park in less than a week.
Councilor Ed Flynn calls for reduced needle distribution as Boston dispenses over 81,000 monthly for harm reduction.
Residents urge city action on drug-related safety issues; incidents like a child stepping on a needle raise concerns.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant noted Jayson Tatum is ahead in his Achilles recovery compared to Durant's own past experience.
Durant praised Tatum's rehab progress, citing advanced medicine and Tatum's impressive ability to dunk just six months post-surgery.
Tatum is considering a return this NBA season, an optimistic shift from initial recovery expectations, according to Durant.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings overcame personal loss to excel in Patriots' 24-23 victory over the Falcons.
Douglas recorded his first 100-yard game with a touchdown, while Jennings scored his first career NFL touchdown.
Jennings was signed off the practice squad and stepped up due to Rhamondre Stevenson's injury, gaining 35 yards.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots secure 24-23 win over Falcons despite turnovers and defensive struggles at Gillette Stadium.
Mike Vrabel emphasizes joy and camaraderie after nail-biting victory, praising team's resilience.
Drake Maye throws for 259 yards and two touchdowns, credits Vrabel's positive coaching influence.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Setti Warren, former Newton mayor, died unexpectedly at his home in Newton at age 55.
Warren was the first African American elected mayor in Massachusetts, serving Newton from 2009 to 2018.
Warren's roles included Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard and work in national politics.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas had a career-high game with over 100 yards and a touchdown, contributing significantly to Patriots' victory.
Drake Maye showed inconsistency with two turnovers, but managed key throws under pressure, sustaining his offensive impact.
Marcus Jones was targeted by Falcons using Drake London's height advantage, resulting in two touchdowns against him in red zone.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A survey by the Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association shows a decrease in residents feeling 'less safe' downtown since last year.
Despite a drop in safety concerns, 92% of respondents still view public safety as an urgent issue in the downtown area.
The Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit discussed issues like drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure, calling for further improvements.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots win 24-23 against Falcons with key missed extra point by ex-Patriot kicker Parker Romo sealing victory.
Drake Maye contributed 259 passing yards, two touchdowns, but costly turnovers allowed Falcons 10 points.
Terrell Jennings scored first NFL touchdown; Patriots' run game achieved 110 total rushing yards without Rhamondre Stevenson.
